headline.main: Your Friday Briefing: Nuclear Security Summit, Tesla Motors, Zaha Hadid

docs.snippet: Ms. Hadid, the first woman to win the Pritzker Prize, was renowned for her theoretical work that left a mark on skylines around the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Hadid, the first woman to win the Pritzker Prize, was renowned for her theoretical work that left a mark on skylines around the world.
docs.abstract: Dame Zaha Hadid, award-winning Iraqi-born British architect whose pioneering, soaring buildings challenged limits of architecture worldwide, dies at age 65; her eye-popping work, containing formal fluidity, was highly appealing to younger generation.

headline.main: Zaha Hadid, Groundbreaking Architect, Dies at 65
headline.print_headline: Architecture Pioneer Whose Soaring Lines Defied Limits Globally

docs.snippet: Interviews and child-protection records document a failure of oversight by government agencies that shared responsibility for the welfare of children placed in the care of Cesar Gonzales-Mugaburu on Long Island....
docs.lead_paragraph: Interviews and child-protection records document a failure of oversight by government agencies that shared responsibility for the welfare of children placed in the care of Cesar Gonzales-Mugaburu on Long Island.
docs.abstract: Reports find lack of oversight by government agencies that shared responsibility for welfare of children placed in care of Cesar Gonzales-Mugaburu, Long Island, NY, foster parent arrested on charges of sexually abusing at least five children and endangering two others; Gonzales-Mugaburu had over 100 boys placed in his care over decades, but after at least 12 complaints Suffolk County had stopped using his services.

headline.main: An ‘Exemplary’ Foster Father, a String of Suspicions and Sexual-Abuse Charges
headline.print_headline: Taking In Scores of Boys, Despite Warnings

byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
